x: 呼び出す・よびだす・1

sense.gloss: usher who calls the names of wrestlers, sweeps the ring, etc.
telephone number at which a person without a telephone can be reached
box-shaped area containing clean water for rinsing oneself (in an Edo-period bathhouse)
high-ranking prostitute in the Yoshiwara district (Edo period)
unlicensed prostitute in the Fukagawa red-light district (Edo period)
name, designation, denomination, naming, giving a name
popular name, common name, given name
to call out to, to hail, to address
denouncing, calling (e.g. someone a thief), branding (as)
pronouncing successively (usu. repeating a syllable with voicing, as in "tsuzuku")
to summon, to call (e.g. phone), to convene, to decoy, to lure
to invoke (e.g. subroutine), to call, to open (e.g. a file)
to call in, to invite, to bring in

to call (to mind), to bring back (memories), to evoke, to arouse (e.g. interest)
barker, tout, hawker, someone who attempts to attract patrons to entertainment events, shops, bars, and such, by exhorting passing public
addressing (someone) without using a suffix such as "-san" or "-chan" (considered impolite)
to call, to summon, to send for, to call together
to (call and) stop, to call (someone) to stop, to hail (e.g. a taxi)
to call (someone) back, to recall, to call home
to bring back (memories, etc.), to recall, to revive
uh huh, yeah yeah, right, gotcha
the harmonizing, mentally and physically, of two parties engaged in an activity, singing from the same hymn-sheet, dancing to the same beat
to wake up (someone; by calling out), to awaken
to bring back (e.g. memories), to evoke, to recall
to call in, to invite, to bring in
to summon, to get used to call
to call out, to ask someone to come
bell (used for summoning or signalling), buzzer

sense.gloss: nasal respiration, breathing through one's nose
true parrot (esp. small parrots such as the parakeet, lory and conure)
to be called (a name), to be referred to (as)
to be treated to something (e.g. a meal), to be invited to

sdata.j: ↑警察↑↓けいさつ↓を↑呼↑↓よ↓んで！
sdata.e: Call the police!

sdata.j: ↑飛行機↑↓ひこうき↓が↑乱気流↑↓らんきりゅう↓に↑近付↑↓ちかづ↓いていたため↑操縦↑↓そうじゅう↓↑士↑↓し↓は↑乗客↑↓じょうきゃく↓にシートベルトを↑締↑↓し↓めるよう↑呼↑↓よ↓びかけた。
sdata.e: As the plane was approaching turbulence, the pilot asked the passengers aboard the plane to fasten their seat belts.

sdata.j: ↑結婚式↑↓けっこんしき↓ではあまりにたくさんのごちそうが↑出↑↓だ↓されたので、↑新郎↑↓しんろう↓↑新婦↑↓しんぷ↓はもっと↑多↑↓おお↓くの↑人↑↓ひと↓を↑呼↑↓よ↓ぶべきだったかなと↑思↑↓おも↓い↑始↑↓はじ↓めた。
sdata.e: Food and drink were served in such profusion at the wedding that the bride and groom began to wonder if they should not have invited more guests.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓は、↑私↑↓わたし↓が↑私↑↓わたし↓の↑友人↑↓ゆうじん↓と↑呼↑↓よ↓べる↑世界↑↓せかい↓でただ↑一↑↓いち↓↑人↑↓にん↓の↑人↑↓ひと↓です。
sdata.e: You are the only man in the world that I can call my friend.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓の↑名前↑↓なまえ↓が↑呼↑↓よ↓ばれるのが↑聞↑↓き↓こえませんでしたか。
sdata.e: Didn't you hear your name called?

sdata.j: あなたは↑名前↑↓なまえ↓を↑呼↑↓よ↓ばれたのが↑聞↑↓き↓こえなかったのですか。
sdata.e: Didn't you hear your name called?

sdata.j: ↑具合↑↓ぐあい↓がよくありません。↑医者↑↓いしゃ↓を↑呼↑↓よ↓びにやってくれませんか。
sdata.e: I'm sick. Will you send for a doctor?

sdata.j: ↑緊急↑↓きんきゅう↓の↑場合↑↓ばあい↓は↑警察↑↓けいさつ↓を↑呼↑↓よ↓びなさい。
sdata.e: In case of an emergency, call the police.

sdata.j: ↑去年↑↓きょねん↓↑建↑↓た↓てられた↑遊園↑↓ゆうえん↓↑地↑↓ち↓のおかげで、その↑町↑↓まち↓は↑人気↑↓にんき↓を↑呼↑↓よ↓ぶようになった。
sdata.e: Thanks to the amusement park built last year, the city has become popular.

sdata.j: ↑救急↑↓きゅうきゅう↓↑車↑↓しゃ↓を↑呼↑↓よ↓んでくれ。
sdata.e: Call an ambulance.

sdata.j: ↑救急↑↓きゅうきゅう↓↑車↑↓しゃ↓を↑呼↑↓よ↓んで！
sdata.e: Call an ambulance.

sdata.j: ↑顔色↑↓かおいろ↓が↑悪↑↓わる↓いですね。↑医者↑↓いしゃ↓を↑呼↑↓よ↓びましょうか。
sdata.e: You look pale. Shall I call the doctor?

sdata.j: ↑歓呼↑↓かんこ↓の↑声↑↓こえ↓を↑上↑↓あ↓げて↑彼↑↓かれ↓を↑主将↑↓しゅしょう↓に↑選↑↓えら↓んだ。
sdata.e: We cheered for him and chose him as our captain.

sdata.j: ↑歓呼↑↓かんこ↓の↑声↑↓こえ↓はどよめきにまで↑高↑↓たか↓まった。
sdata.e: The cheers swelled to a roar.

sdata.j: ↑学生↑↓がくせい↓↑達↑↓たち↓は↑校長↑↓こうちょう↓に↑呼↑↓よ↓ばれてあつまった。
sdata.e: The students gathered at the call of the principal.

sdata.j: ↑階段↑↓かいだん↓を↑上↑↓のぼ↓りながら↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑父親↑↓ちちおや↓を↑呼↑↓よ↓んだ。
sdata.e: He called his father as he went up the stairs.

sdata.j: ↑会議↑↓かいぎ↓↑中↑↓ちゅう↓の↑彼↑↓かれ↓を↑呼↑↓よ↓び↑出↑↓だ↓せますか。
sdata.e: Could you please call him into the meeting?

sdata.j: ↑我々↑↓われわれ↓は↑教育↑↓きょういく↓の↑方法↑↓ほうほう↓を↑時代↑↓じだい↓に↑呼応↑↓こおう↓させなくてはならない。
sdata.e: We have to bring our teaching methods up to date.

sdata.j: ↑我々↑↓われわれ↓はこの↑町↑↓まち↓を↑小↑↓しょう↓↑京都↑↓きょうと↓と↑呼↑↓よ↓ぶ。
sdata.e: We refer to this city as Little Kyoto.

sdata.j: ↑貨幣↑↓かへい↓が、↑人類↑↓じんるい↓↑最大↑↓さいだい↓の↑発明↑↓はつめい↓↑品↑↓ひん↓のひとつだとこれまで↑呼↑↓よ↓ばれてきたのにも、↑十分↑↓じゅうぶん↓な↑理由↑↓りゆう↓がある。
sdata.e: It is without justification that money has been called one of the greatest inventions of man.

sdata.j: ↑遠↑↓とお↓くから↑誰↑↓だれ↓かが↑私↑↓わたし↓に↑呼↑↓よ↓びかけているのが↑聞↑↓き↓こえた。
sdata.e: I heard someone calling me from a distance.

sdata.j: ↑駅前↑↓えきまえ↓の↑人込↑↓ひとご↓みの↑中↑↓なか↓で、↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑誰↑↓だれ↓かが↑私↑↓わたし↓の↑名前↑↓なまえ↓を↑呼↑↓よ↓ぶのを↑聞↑↓き↓いた。
sdata.e: I heard someone in the crowd outside the station call my name.

sdata.j: ↑駅↑↓えき↓に↑着↑↓つ↓くとすぐ、↑彼↑↓かれ↓はタクシーを↑呼↑↓よ↓んだ。
sdata.e: On his arrival at the station, he called a taxi.

sdata.j: ↑英国↑↓えいこく↓の↑詩人↑↓しじん↓↑Ｐ↑↓ぴー↓．シェリーは↑地獄↑↓じごく↓をロンドンによく↑似↑↓に↓た↑町↑↓まち↓であると↑呼↑↓よ↓びさえした。
sdata.e: The English poet Percy Shelley went so far as to call hell a city much like London.

sdata.j: ↑英語↑↓えいご↓の↑発音↑↓はつおん↓の↑呼吸↑↓こきゅう↓がなかなか↑飲↑↓の↓み↑込↑↓こ↓めない。
sdata.e: I still can't get the knack of English pronunciation.

sdata.j: ↑英語↑↓えいご↓ではこの↑鳥↑↓とり↓をなんと↑呼↑↓よ↓びますか。
sdata.e: What do you call this bird in English?

sdata.j: ↑宇宙↑↓うちゅう↓↑飛行↑↓ひこう↓↑士↑↓し↓たちは、↑彼↑↓かれ↓らの↑熱狂↑↓ねっきょう↓↑的↑↓てき↓な↑歓呼↑↓かんこ↓と↑喝采↑↓かっさい↓で↑迎↑↓むか↓えられた。
sdata.e: The astronauts were greeted by their enthusiastic cheers and applause.

sdata.j: ↑一度↑↓いちど↓↑放↑↓はな↓たれた↑石↑↓いし↓と↑言葉↑↓ことば↓は↑呼↑↓よ↓び↑戻↑↓もど↓せない。
sdata.e: A stone once cast, and a word once spoken, cannot be recalled.

sdata.j: ↑医者↑↓いしゃ↓を↑呼↑↓よ↓んで↑下↑↓くだ↓さい。
sdata.e: Please call me a doctor.

sdata.j: ↑医者↑↓いしゃ↓を↑呼↑↓よ↓んでもらえますか。
sdata.e: Could you call a doctor, please?
